aws::graph::propositions: Acquisition Integration Challenges
The difficulty of incorporating acquired operations, technology, and rights into our offerings exists.
Unanticipated expenses related to integration of acquired operations, technology, and rights may occur.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's accounting systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's financial reporting systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's sustainability reporting systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's management systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's information systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's data security systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's human resource systems to permit effective management exists.
The difficulty of integrating a new company's administrative systems to permit effective management exists.
Lack of control may occur if integration is delayed.
Lack of control may occur if integration is not successfully implemented.
Losses may be incurred as a result of declines in the value of an investment.
Losses may be incurred as a result of incorporating an investee's financial performance into financial results.
For certain investments, there is dependence on the investee's accounting systems.
For certain investments, there is dependence on the investee's financial reporting systems.
For certain investments, there is dependence on the investee's sustainability reporting systems.
For certain investments, there is dependence on the investee's controls.
For certain investments, there is dependence on the investee's procedures.
For certain investments, there is dependence on the investee's processes.
The dependence on investee's systems applies when an investee's financial performance is incorporated into financial results.
The dependence on investee's systems applies for investments requiring filing of financial statements.
The dependence on investee's systems applies for investments requiring provision of financial information.
The difficulty of implementing controls at acquired companies exists.
The difficulty of implementing procedures at acquired companies exists.
